DataElement.preferredName: PDL1/PD1 Pharmacologic Substance Administered Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded response indicating whether a patient meets the eligibility criteria regardingI PDL1/PD1 therapy.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to PDL1/PD1 inhibitor administered

ObjectClass.preferredName: Programmed Cell Death 1 Ligand 1 Pharmacologic Substance
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Programmed cell death 1 ligand 1 (290 aa, ~33 kDa) is encoded by the human CD274 gene. This protein is involved in the mediation of both the activation and proliferation of T cells.:Any natural, endogenously-derived, synthetic or semi-synthetic compound with pharmacologic activity. A pharmacologic substance has one or more specific mechanism of action(s) through which it exerts one or more effect(s) on the human or animal body. They can be used to potentially prevent, diagnose, treat or relieve symptoms of a disease. Formulation specific agents and some combination agents are also classified as pharmacologic substances.

Concepts.definition: Programmed cell death 1 ligand 1 (290 aa, ~33 kDa) is encoded by the human CD274 gene. This protein is involved in the mediation of both the activation and proliferation of T cells.

Any natural, endogenously-derived, synthetic or semi-synthetic compound with pharmacologic activity. A pharmacologic substance has one or more specific mechanism of action(s) through which it exerts one or more effect(s) on the human or animal body. They can be used to potentially prevent, diagnose, treat or relieve symptoms of a disease. Formulation specific agents and some combination agents are also classified as pharmacologic substances.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: If patient is not eligible to
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is not eligible to receive PD1/PD-L1 therapy due to requirement for systemic steroid therapy greater than 10mg of prednisone, or its equivalent, has eligibility been discussed with Principal investigator [provided that their steroid daily dose is between 10-19 mg of prednisone (or its equivalent)]?
